title: Blueprint, "Albright Art Gallery: Library Elevations", 1932
medium:
Blueprint; double ruled border 
Support: white wove paper
markings: Stamps: Architect's stamp at lower right: EDW. B. GREEN & SON/ARCHITECTS/ONE NIAGARA SQUARE/BUFFALO, N.Y.; see inscription
inscribed: Architect's stamp inscribed: LIBRARY/PLAN ELEVATIONS/DETAILS; ALBRIGHT ART GALLERY/BUFFALO N.Y.; 1/4"=1'-0" / 1/2"=1'-0" / 1 1/2"=1'-0"; 10-15-32 Inscribed above architect's stamp: PRINTED OCT. 18, 1932; 1 [circled] Inscribed with dimensions, descriptions and notes throughout
description: Blueprint of elevations and floor plans for library, Albright Art Gallery, Buffalo, NY. Floor plan at center shows square-shaped room, surrounded by built in shelves and cabinets on all four walls, three large rectangular library tables arranged in the center, and a card index unit on right wall, door at right. Typewriter desk positioned perpendicular to doorway. Wall elevations show dimensions of shelves. In lower left corner is design for print boxes in three different sizes, to be placed on sliding shelves.

tombstone.epitaph:
Blueprint, "Albright Art Gallery: Library Elevations", 1932.
1932. Blueprint; double ruled border 
Support: white wove paper. Gift of Donald Deskey. 1975-11-302.
